message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <handle>.
2) OPEN <handle>.
3) PICK <object> PLACE <location>, <object> can be either cup or mug; PICK and PLACE is considered one single ACTION, i.e. you must always PICK and PLACE together
4) WAIT: stays at current position, choose WAIT to hold the door open.
<handle> must be either left or right door handle. Only OPEN a door after you already PICKed its handle, after you OPENed a door, must WAIT at the same spot to hold it open. 
<object> must be either mug or cup, <location> must be the correct coaster.

[Action Output Instruction]
Must first output 'EXECUTE
', then give **exactly** one action per robot, put each on a new line.
Example: 'EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK mug PLACE mug_coaster
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
NAME Chad ACTION OPEN left_door_handle
'



You are Bob, collaborate with Alice, Chad to pick a mug and a cup out of cabinet, and place them on correct coasters.
Both left and right cabinet doors should be OPENed and held open, while anything inside can be PICKed.
You must coordinate to complete the task most efficiently while avoiding collision.
You can only reach right_door_handle.
At current round:
left door is closed, left_door_handle is at (-0.4, 0.3, 0.6), right door is closed, right_door_handle is at (-0.4, 0.6, 0.6), 
mug is inside cabinet; cup is inside cabinet; 
Your gripper is at (-0.1 1.3 0.6), holding nothing, 
Alice's gripper is at (0.4 -0.1 0.5), holding nothing, 
Chad's gripper is at (1.1 1.2 0.4), holding nothing, 
Think step-by-step about the task and others' response. Carefully check and correct them if they made a mistake. 
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].

When you respond, tell others about your goal and all constraints. Respond very concisely but informatively, and do not repeat what others have said.
Discuss together to come up with the best plan. Never forget you are Bob! Never forget you can only reach right_door_handle!
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options]. At least one robot should be acting, you can't all WAIT.
End your response by either: 1) output PROCEED, if the plans require further discussion, or 2) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output EXECUTE and the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!



[Current Chat]
[Alice]:
I will pick the left_door_handle and hold it open for Bob and Chad to access the mug and cup. Bob, you can pick the mug and place it on the mug_coaster. Chad, you can pick the cup and place it on the cup_coaster. Let's discuss our actions and make sure we are all on the same page.

My action for this round: PICK left_door_handle
PROCEED
[Bob]:
Thanks, Alice. I will open the right cabinet door to access the mug and cup. Chad, please open the left cabinet door after Alice picks the left_door_handle.

My action for this round: PICK right_door_handle
PROCEED
[Chad]:
Thanks, Alice and Bob. I will open the left cabinet door after Alice picks the left_door_handle, and then I can pick the cup and place it on the cup_coaster.

My action for this round: OPEN left_door_handle
PROCEED
[Alice]:
Chad, you should wait for me to pick the left_door_handle before you open the left cabinet door. Also, Bob, you should open the right cabinet door after picking the right_door_handle.

My action for this round: PICK left_door_handle
PROCEED
You are Bob, your response is:

Thanks for the correction, Alice. Chad, please wait for Alice to pick the left_door_handle before opening the left cabinet door.

My action for this round: PICK right_door_handle
PROCEED
